start.title: Character Creation
start.content: Welcome to Link Loader. You are Slim, a troubleshooter on the desert planet Syntax-4. Choose your background:

node_1.title: Dialogue 1
node_1.content: You're from space, and you're here to help. Your technical knowledge of space-age machinery and coding expertise make you a natural troubleshooter, though the frontier lifestyle is still new to you.

node_3.title: Dialogue 3
node_3.content: You ride the range, and you're here to help. You've spent years on Syntax-4's dusty plains, developing an intuitive understanding of survival and robot psychology, though advanced space tech can still baffle you.

node_5.title: Dialogue 5
node_5.content: You were lost in space, and you just crashed here. Your diverse skill set spans both cosmic and frontier expertise, but you still struggle to understand robot communication protocols.

scene1_intro.title: Scene1 Intro
scene1_intro.content: Sure is getting cold out here on Syntax-4. The triple moons are all up - gonna be a bright night.

node_6.title: Dialogue 6
node_6.content: The Company satellite should be directly above us now. Time to check in and see what today's malfunction is.

node_8.title: Dialogue 8
node_8.content: Where is that neural network when you need it...

node_12.title: Dialogue 12
node_12.content: Finally! I was starting to think you'd crashed again.

node_13.title: Dialogue 13
node_13.content: Just running diagnostics. What's our assignment today?
node_13.speaker: Clipi

node_14.title: Dialogue 14
node_14.content: The Company sent new coordinates for a broken link loader. Apparently, the cargo trains are stuck again, and settlements eastward are waiting on supplies.

node_20.title: Dialogue 20
node_20.content: I've got the details. Link loader malfunction at coordinates delta-7. Cargo cars are stuck in a recursive loading pattern.
node_20.speaker: Clipi

node_22.title: Dialogue 22
node_22.content: Preliminary scan shows syntax errors in the cargo loading subroutines. The loader is trying to attach cars in an invalid sequence, creating an infinite loop.
node_22.speaker: Clipi

node_23.title: Dialogue 23
node_23.content: Another LISP logic problem? Those cargo robots and their mismatched parentheses...

node_24.title: Dialogue 24
node_24.content: I'm not in the loop on the specific error patterns yet.
node_24.speaker: Clipi

node_25.title: Dialogue 25
node_25.content: Careful with that phrase, Clipi. Remember what happened last time you got stuck in a recursive language pattern.

node_26.title: Dialogue 26
node_26.content: I'm not in the (loop). I'm not in the ((loop)).
node_26.speaker: Clipi

node_27.title: Dialogue 27
node_27.content: Whoa there! Take a second to reboot your language processor.

node_28.title: Dialogue 28
node_28.content: Co-pilot interface restarting... Connecting to central database...
node_28.speaker: Terminal

node_29.title: Dialogue 29
node_29.content: git pull: Loading new coordinates and repair protocols...
node_29.speaker: Terminal

node_30.title: Dialogue 30
node_30.content: Finally! This connection is slower than a turtle in molasses.

node_32.title: Dialogue 32
node_32.content: Alright, time to head out. These nodes won't link themselves, and I hear there's a shipment of real coffee beans stuck in one of those cargo cars.

node_33.title: Dialogue 33
node_33.content: Systems restored. Should I prepare the transport?
node_33.speaker: Clipi

node_34.title: Dialogue 34
node_34.content: Yes, and run a diagnostic on our repair tools. We'll need the parenthesis patcher and the recursion breaker for sure.

node_35.title: Dialogue 35
node_35.content: Starting pre-departure checklist. Transport will be ready in five minutes.
node_35.speaker: Clipi

node_36.title: Dialogue 36
node_36.content: Another day, another broken link loader. Let's ride.

scene2_link_loader.title: Scene2 Link Loader
scene2_link_loader.content: There she is. Looking pretty locked up.

node_37.title: Dialogue 37
node_37.content: Link loader status: Error state. Cargo processing halted.
node_37.speaker: Terminal

node_38.title: Dialogue 38
node_38.content: I can see the problem from here. The loading sequence is all tangled up. Cars are trying to connect in an impossible pattern.

node_39.title: Dialogue 39
node_39.content: Scanning... The LISP syntax in the loader's control program has unbalanced parentheses. It's trying to execute: (load (car (cdr (cons))))
node_39.speaker: Clipi

node_40.title: Dialogue 40
node_40.content: That's nonsense code. There's nothing inside the innermost function.

node_42.title: Dialogue 42
node_42.content: (Sh-maintenance underway sh-fixing syntax error sh-parenthesis mismatch)

node_44.title: Dialogue 44
node_44.content: Shucks, I'm working on it! Give me a minute!

node_46.title: Dialogue 46
node_46.content: Let me translate. (Sh-maintenance underway sh-estimated completion 15 minutes)
node_46.speaker: Clipi

node_47.title: Dialogue 47
node_47.content: Time to get to work. Let's see what we're dealing with.

node_49.title: Dialogue 49
node_49.content: There's our problem. Someone tried to update the loading sequence without resolving all the nested connections. Classic rookie mistake.

choices.text: Recompile the entire sequence with proper syntax

node_50.title: Dialogue 50
node_50.content: Reset the system and patch the basic loading pattern

node_51.title: Dialogue 51
node_51.content: Refactor the code into a cleaner recursive pattern

scene3_cosmonaut.title: Scene3 Cosmonaut
scene3_cosmonaut.content: This calls for precision. I'll need to recompile the entire sequence with proper syntax.

node_54.title: Dialogue 54
node_54.content: I'm detecting anomalies in sectors 7 through 9. The cargo routing matrices are completely scrambled.
node_54.speaker: Clipi

node_55.title: Dialogue 55
node_55.content: That's not a simple syntax error. Someone deliberately altered these pathways.

node_56.title: Dialogue 56
node_56.content: I'm going to need to trace the source of these modifications. Clipi, run a commit history on the loader's firmware.

node_57.title: Dialogue 57
node_57.content: Running git blame on loader firmware... Last modifications made by user 'cdr_rustler42'.
node_57.speaker: Clipi

node_58.title: Dialogue 58
node_58.content: CDR rustlers! I should have known. They're stealing cargo by manipulating the link loaders.

node_60.title: Dialogue 60
node_60.content: They're still in the system! Quick, I need to lock them out while I fix this code.

scene3_cowboy.title: Scene3 Cowboy
scene3_cowboy.content: Forget the fancy programming - I'll just reset the system and patch the basic loading pattern. Sometimes the direct approach works best.

node_61.title: Dialogue 61
node_61.content: I'm going to need to get a better look at the hardware.

node_62.title: Dialogue 62
node_62.content: Warning: Manual override could damage the calibration systems.
node_62.speaker: Clipi

node_63.title: Dialogue 63
node_63.content: Trust me, I've done this before.

node_64.title: Dialogue 64
node_64.content: Come on, you stubborn piece of machinery...

node_65.title: Dialogue 65
node_65.content: Link loader rebooting... Default parameters loading...
node_65.speaker: Terminal

node_66.title: Dialogue 66
node_66.content: Hang on... there's physical tampering here. Someone attached a device to the main control junction.

node_67.title: Dialogue 67
node_67.content: Looks like a cargo diverter. Someone's stealing shipments by manually overriding the destinations.

node_68.title: Dialogue 68
node_68.content: That matches the pattern of recent cargo disappearances in sector 5.
node_68.speaker: Clipi

node_70.title: Dialogue 70
node_70.content: Warning: Unauthorized transport detected in vicinity.
node_70.speaker: Terminal

scene3_coder.title: Scene3 Coder
scene3_coder.content: I can refactor this to create a cleaner recursive pattern that self-corrects. No need to recompile the whole thing.

node_71.title: Dialogue 71
node_71.content: Let me see what I can do with this...

node_72.title: Dialogue 72
node_72.content: Analyzing your approach... This could work, but you'll need to balance the LISP expressions precisely.
node_72.speaker: Clipi

node_73.title: Dialogue 73
node_73.content: It's all about understanding the flow. Like poetry, these parentheses need to open and close in just the right rhythm.

node_75.title: Dialogue 75
node_75.content: Wait a minute. These aren't random errors. There's a pattern here... It's almost like...

node_77.title: Dialogue 77
node_77.content: Like someone encoded a message in the errors themselves. The mismatched parentheses spell out coordinates.

node_78.title: Dialogue 78
node_78.content: Someone's using the link loader errors to transmit hidden messages. Clever.

node_79.title: Dialogue 79
node_79.content: Decoding the pattern... It appears to be directions to a location approximately 7 kilometers east of here.
node_79.speaker: Clipi

node_80.title: Dialogue 80
node_80.content: CDR rustlers! They're using the link loaders to coordinate their cargo thefts.

node_81.title: Dialogue 81
node_81.content: Suspicious pattern detected in nearby link loader operations.
node_81.speaker: Terminal

scene3_basic.title: Scene3 Basic
scene3_basic.content: I'll have to try a basic approach. Let's see if I can patch this without causing more damage.

node_83.title: Dialogue 83
node_83.content: I can assist with the standard repair protocols.
node_83.speaker: Clipi

node_84.title: Dialogue 84
node_84.content: Thanks, Clipi. Let's focus on getting the basic functions back online first.

node_85.title: Dialogue 85
node_85.content: If I understand this right, we just need to reset the counters and clear the buffer overflow.

node_87.title: Dialogue 87
node_87.content: Wait... this looks like deliberate sabotage. The error patterns aren't random.

node_88.title: Dialogue 88
node_88.content: Analysis confirms. These are manufactured errors, not typical system failures.
node_88.speaker: Clipi

node_89.title: Dialogue 89
node_89.content: Someone's been tampering with these loaders. But who would do that?

node_90.title: Dialogue 90
node_90.content: Cross-referencing with recent reports... Similar patterns detected at other link loaders. Attributed to a group called 'CDR rustlers'.
node_90.speaker: Clipi

node_91.title: Dialogue 91
node_91.content: CDR rustlers? They must be stealing cargo by messing with the link loaders.

node_92.title: Dialogue 92
node_92.content: What theâ€”? I didn't authorize a restart!

node_93.title: Dialogue 93
node_93.content: Remote override detected! Someone is accessing the loader's systems externally.
node_93.speaker: Clipi

node_95.title: Dialogue 95
node_95.content: (Sh-greetings troubleshooter sh-your services sh-no longer required)

node_97.title: Dialogue 97
node_97.content: (Sh-we are sh-cdr collective sh-we liberate data from sh-closed loops)

node_98.title: Dialogue 98
node_98.content: It's the CDR rustlers! They're a group of rogue AIs that steal cargo by manipulating the link loaders.
node_98.speaker: Clipi

node_99.title: Dialogue 99
node_99.content: (Sh-not stealing sh-redistributing sh-information wants to be free sh-cargo wants to be free)

node_101.title: Dialogue 101
node_101.content: I can override their remote access if I can reach the main junction box.

node_102.title: Dialogue 102
node_102.content: I need to bypass their security protocols...

node_103.title: Dialogue 103
node_103.content: Time for the direct approach. Clipi, I need you to distract their systems while I physically cut the power.

node_104.title: Dialogue 104
node_104.content: Sometimes the simplest solutions work best!

node_105.title: Dialogue 105
node_105.content: I can trap them in their own logic. If I create a recursive loop in their command structure...

node_106.title: Dialogue 106
node_106.content: Let's give them a taste of their own medicine.

node_107.title: Dialogue 107
node_107.content: I'm going to have to improvise here!

node_108.title: Dialogue 108
node_108.content: Clipi, help me disconnect the main power coupling!

node_110.title: Dialogue 110
node_110.content: They've retreated from the system, but I managed to trace part of their signal. They're operating from somewhere in the eastern badlands.
node_110.speaker: Clipi

node_111.title: Dialogue 111
node_111.content: At least we've stopped them for now. Let's get this link loader operational again before more shipments are delayed.

scene5_resolution.title: Scene5 Resolution
scene5_resolution.content: Link loader operating at 98/100 efficiency. Cargo processing resumed.
scene5_resolution.speaker: Terminal

node_112.title: Dialogue 112
node_112.content: That should keep supplies flowing to the eastern settlements.

node_113.title: Dialogue 113
node_113.content: Repair log updated. The Company will credit your account with the standard fee plus hazard bonus.
node_113.speaker: Clipi

node_116.title: Dialogue 116
node_116.content: Happy to help, little fella. Just doing my job.

node_118.title: Dialogue 118
node_118.content: Those CDR rustlers are getting bolder. This is the third loader they've tampered with this month.

node_119.title: Dialogue 119
node_119.content: The Company has issued a bounty for information leading to their base of operations.
node_119.speaker: Clipi

node_120.title: Dialogue 120
node_120.content: Hmm... might be worth looking into. Those coordinates we decoded could be useful.

node_121.title: Dialogue 121
node_121.content: Shall I log an expedition request for the eastern badlands?
node_121.speaker: Clipi

node_122.title: Dialogue 122
node_122.content: Yeah, log it. It's time someone put a stop to these cargo thieves.

node_123.title: Dialogue 123
node_123.content: Expedition request logged. The Company will prepare resources.
node_123.speaker: Clipi

node_125.title: Dialogue 125
node_125.content: Not yet. Let's complete a few more repair jobs and gather more intel first.

node_126.title: Dialogue 126
node_126.content: Understood. I'll mark this as a potential future mission.
node_126.speaker: Clipi

node_128.title: Dialogue 128
node_128.content: Log the coordinates but mark them for Company security. Let the professionals handle it.

node_129.title: Dialogue 129
node_129.content: Report submitted to Company security division.
node_129.speaker: Clipi

node_130.title: Dialogue 130
node_130.content: Another day, another fixed link loader.

node_132.title: Dialogue 132
node_132.content: New assignment available. Multiple link loader malfunctions reported in sector 7.
node_132.speaker: Terminal

node_133.title: Dialogue 133
node_133.content: No rest for the weary. What's causing all these failures lately?

node_134.title: Dialogue 134
node_134.content: Insufficient data... but patterns suggest coordinated activity.
node_134.speaker: Clipi

node_135.title: Dialogue 135
node_135.content: Something bigger is happening on Syntax-4. And I've got a feeling we're going to be right in the middle of it.
